planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: The smallest planet in our solar system and nearest to the Sun, Mercury is only slightly larger than Earth's Moon

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: The second planet from the Sun and our closest planetary neighbor.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Our home planet is the third planet from the Sun, and the only place we know of so far that’s inhabited by living things.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: The fourth planet from the Sun, Mars is a dusty, cold, desert world with a very thin atmosphere.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: The fifth planet from our Sun and is, by far, the largest planet in the solar system – more than twice as massive as all the other planets combined.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: The sixth planet from the Sun and the second largest planet in our solar system.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: The seventh planet from the Sun with the third largest diameter in our solar system, Uranus is very cold and windy.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Dark, cold and whipped by supersonic winds, ice giant Neptune is the eighth and most distant planet in our solar system.
